availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hoffman (Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant, banker, and notary public)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant, banker, and notary public. Kentucky native. Married to Julia A. Wilkerson Hoffman. Father of Thomas Hoffman, Albert Hoffman, Mary Hoffman, Laure Hoffman, John Hoffman, Annie Hoffman, and Geo Hoffman. Merchant in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Banker in Montgomery County in 1860. Employed Mary McMahon as a servant in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Notary public in Montgomery County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 7A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, pp. 311-312.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 73A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Country, p. 285B.
"William Hoffman (1819-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 84920356, accessed October 15, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84920356.
